@DubLoony @doccer Yes, but without the imprimatur of the state can any such data be trusted. Authoritative used to mean something..
@sNarah Surprising what you get used to. Binliners all over the back seat before set off. These days it's complaints about mobile coverage
@sNarah Mine didn't fly much when they were that age, but a visit to the grandparents meant a 5 hour drive which *always* featured puke.
@sNarah Calpol just before boarding, Peppa Pig episodes downloaded onto the phone (or whatever the current thing is)
@doccer @marklittlenews Entire industries, including mine, rely on unfiltered raw data from the state. A first step to a very dark future

I nearly fell off my barstool there, great win for #Munster Very tough match, proper rugby. #GLAvMUN
No love lost in Glasgow, this is quite a spicy match. #GLAvMUN
@ManMaun To be sure, there are many who live here who were not born here, all very welcome. We exported people for 800 years...
@ManMaun True. I live in a city that existed to export people and beer, now we import both of
@ManMaun That said, Brexit is seriously going to fuck up NI. It'll Fuck us up here South of the border too, way more than you over there
@ManMaun It's a long term aspiration for many people here, but most recognise that the reality is a few hundred years away
@ManMaun No chance in our lifetime. The south can't afford the billions p/a that the UK pumps into the place.
@ManMaun Works with Rugby. Soccer, not quite so.
(Assured-ish)
BP! The home QF is assured, great stuff from #LeinsterRugby
Lots of very nice rugby played in that first half, some of it by Montpellier in the first 20, but most of it by #LeinsterRugby

Game over. Looked slightly reckless to me. Hope Johnny is OK. #Leinster
Tools down, beers up, rugby on. C'mon #Leinster
@StevenFeldman That's a bit of an over simplification on my part, but Brexit will probably impact on Ireland more than UK in the short term
@StevenFeldman As a small country that relies on one for employment and the other for a market, it'll be a tough year here either way
@bkenny 99% of growth, but their dominance is huge alright.

@CiaraMPSI Some of us are fathers of daughters. Daughters who should have every opportunity we were granted.

Happy New Year to you all!

@daraghobrien Would that shut every data centre in the UK?
@jpdiggins Absolutely, but I think the improvements down there are significantly larger than any decline over here.
